communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Bledsoe
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning Daniel Bledsoe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: FOIA request 1408874 (Daniel Bledsoe)
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Best,

We're contacting you about the FOIA request you made for records concerning Daniel Bledsoe. As you probably recall, the FBI located approximately 1330 pages that are potentially responsive to your request. Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium (51-950 pages), large (951-8000 pages), and extra-large (over 8000 pages) sub-tracks based upon request size. 

Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing.  Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process. A review of your request determined that it is currently in the complex request large processing track.  Given our current workload and staffing levels, it may yet be a long time before you begin to receive material from this request.   

Reducing the scope of your request may accelerate the processing and allow for a more timely receipt of the information you seek, as it could potentially place your request into a smaller, faster processing track.  This may also reduce duplication costs, if applicable.  Would you be willing to consider reducing the scope of your request?  If so, I would be happy to help you to decide the best approach to take.  We could potentially narrow your request by date, or if you are looking for something specific, we could approach the scope reduction process in that way.

Please let us know if you would like to potentially reduce the scope of your request.  We can be reached via email at fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov, or you may call 540-868-1695, Monday - Friday between the hours of 7:00am and 3:00pm Eastern time.

Best regards,

FOIA Negotiation Team
FBI Information Management Division
540-868-1695

Need a status check? Contact FOIPA Questions (foipaquestions@fbi.gov).

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Bledsoe
communications.communication: I'm afraid I need the entire file. Can you please confirm that the fee request was made in error, and the Bureau will not be attempting to charge duplication fees for this request?

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Bledsoe
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Best,

You were granted news media status for this request, therefore there should be no fees because the page count is less than 5,000. We will continue processing the request in full. Thank you for following up.

Best regards,

FOIA Negotiation Team
FBI Information Management Division
540-868-1695

Need a status check? Contact FOIPA Questions (foipaquestions@fbi.gov).

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Truleo Contracts (Elkton Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Contracts, agreements, invoices, and any supporting documentation related to the use of applications named or provided by Truleo.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mitchell Kotler

The requested invoice and user agreement has been attached.  If there are any questions or concerns please contact me directly at rodom@elktonpd.org or (410) 398-4200 x7018.

Lt. Ron Odom, Elkton Police Support Services Commander

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NPRC JW 8.7.23
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

All publicly releasable military and civilian records for Louis Jolyon West (October 6, 1924 – January 2, 1999). Mr. West's social security number was  395-16-2395. He served in the United States Air Force (USAF) between approximately 1948 and 1956, and worked as a civilian contractor at the 3700th USAF Hospital at the Lackland Air Force Base after that. Therefore, I am requesting the following information from Mr. West's Official Military Personnel File (OMPF) and his Official Personnel Folder (OPF). This information includes, but is not limited to:

• Name

• Service Number

• Certificate of Release/Discharge Papers, aka DD form 214

• Dates of Service

• Branch of Service

• Final Duty Status

• Final Rank

• Salary

• Assignments and Geographical Locations

• Source of Commission

• Military Education Level

• Awards and decorations

• Civilian positions

• Civilian titles

• Civilian salaries

• Civilian grades

• Civilian job locations

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the National Personnel Records Center has no other copies of said records.

You will find as an attachment a copy of Mr. West's obituary from the The New York Times, published on January 9, 1999.

I am asking you waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. My bylines, which include Creem Magazine, Covert Action Magazine, and the Geopolitical Economy Report, can be found in both print and electronic publications. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

A fee waiver is appropriate in situations where "disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of the government, and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester,” 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(iii). Mr. West, per the attached obituary, was a figure of considerable public interest. He worked for the government, both during his time in the USAF and as a civilian contractor, during the Korean War, on research related to the alleged brainwashing of American prisoners-of-war, by Korean, Soviet, and Chinese officials. Mr. West's OMPF and OPF would help provide the public with a better understanding of military and civilian-guided research on this subject during the Korean War.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. All documents will be provided to the general public without charge.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $250. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: NPRC JW 8.7.23
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am following up on a request sent under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552, on August 8, 2023. I have not received a response identifying a request number and thus cannot provide that information at this time.

In my original request, attached, I asked for the Official Military Personnel File (OMPF) and Official Personnel Folder (OPF) for Louis Jolyon West (October 6, 1924 – January 2, 1999; SSN 395-16-2395). Mr. West served in the United States Air Force (USAF) between approximately 1948 and 1956 and worked as a civilian contractor for the USAF at the 3700th USAF Hospital at the Lackland Air Force Base after that.  I am reproducing a copy of the New York Times obituary I attached to the original request.

By law, 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(i), agencies are required to make a determination within 20 working days of a request. Given that the request was sent on August 8th, at least 49 working days have passed as of the date of the correspondence and as such, I am requesting an update on the status of my request. This includes both a request number and time frame for processing.

I am also renewing my request for a fee waiver. I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. My bylines, which include Unicorn Riot, the Geopolitical Economy Report, and Creem Magazine, can be found in both print and electronic publications. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

A fee waiver is appropriate in situations where "disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of the government, and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester,” 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(iii). Mr. West, per the attached obituary, was a figure of considerable public interest. He worked for the government, both during his time in the USAF and as a civilian contractor, during the Korean War, on research related to the alleged brainwashing of American prisoners-of-war by Korean, Soviet, and Chinese officials. Mr. West's OMPF and OPF would help provide the public with a better understanding of military and civilian-guided research on this subject during the Korean War.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

communications.communication: Good afternoon, I just had a couple questions regarding the data provided. I was curious if this dataset is representative of the 2023 fiscal year (from 7/1/2022 - 6/30/2023) as requested, or if the data provided was an as-of "snapshot" based on the report run date? I ask because it appears there are several employees with "Company Seniority Dates" and "Employees State Begin Dates" beyond the 2023 fiscal year. Can you also clarify which field should be considered the Employee Start Date, and may we also get a list of non-abbreviated "Companies"?

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: State of Virginia Salaries 2023
communications.communication:
Good morning, 

I wanted to follow up on my previous email from 8/30 regarding the effective date of the data provided as well as a list of non-abbreviated "Companies". 

I also wanted to inquire about a record count discrepancy between this data and data previously released by this office in response to a separate request for 2022 employee compensation data. 2022's data had over 110,000 employee records released while this year has about 55,000 employee records. Looking at some specific employees existing in 2022 that do not exist in the 2023 data, it appears that most of those records belong to "Faculty, University Staff, and Political Jurisdiction Staff" with record counts of those classifications having the approximate record count of the difference between the two files. 

Would you be able to clarify the effective date of the data (FY 2023 as requested, or a snapshot in time as of the run of the report), as well as the field that could be considered Employee Start Date? Would it be possible to include these records in the 2023 disclosure as they were provided in response to a separate request for 2022 employee compensation data?  If you could a "key" between the company abbreviation provided and their non-abbreviated descriptions/names, that would also be greatly appreciated. 

Best,
Tyler

title: Missouri Drug Free Zone Sentence Information (Missouri Highway Patrol)

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Missouri Drug Free Zone Sentence Information (Missouri Highway Patrol)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all records related to persons serving drug free zone law sentence enhancements– as mentioned in Missouri Revised Statutes 579.030, 579.055, 579.065.3(11)  – in the state of Missouri on the state and local levels. These records should, if available, state names, date of conviction, inmate ID and parole eligibility date and any demographic data that has been collected.  I am specifically looking for records from 2015 to the date that this request is processed.

In addition, I am requesting a copy of any and all reports or studies generated by the state that discuss the passage and efficacy of the drug free zone law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P044805-103023
communications.communication:
Dear Jenny Wadhwa: 
Our office received your open records request pursuant to Missouri's Sunshine Law, Chapter 610, RSMo. Your request has been assigned number P044805-103023. The Patrol is committed to adhering to the Sunshine Law and to ensuring that the public obtains access to open records that are not otherwise closed by law. The Sunshine Law requires each public agency to adhere to certain standards. This letter is designed to ensure that you understand our process for fulfilling your records request. Three Business Day Notice Requirement: 
The requested records are not immediately available for dissemination or inspection. The Patrol is required to notify you that additional research time will be required to fulfill the request. This correspondence satisfies the Sunshine Law's notice requirement within the required three business day period. Section 610.023.3, RSMo. 
 Additional Research Time is Required: 
The Patrol receives thousands of open records requests each month. Our Patrol Records Division personnel are dedicated to meeting the intent of Missouri's Sunshine Law and strive to respond to each request in a timely manner. The Patrol operates in all 114 Missouri counties and the independent city of St. Louis. Accordingly, many records maintained by the agency are not centrally located within, or immediately accessible to, the Patrol's Custodian of Records in Jefferson City. Our staff must research your request and ensure that we have captured all responsive records  ̶  regardless of their location within the agency. The research process is time-consuming, but we will make every effort to expedite your request. Estimated Time for Completion: 
The majority of our requests are fulfilled within thirty business days. Some requests require additional research time due to their scope or complexity. Our team will conduct an initial review of your request. If we estimate that the request will be fulfilled within thirty business days, we will not send an updated time estimate. However, if we estimate that the request will take longer than thirty business days, we will provide an updated time estimate that provides a detailed justification for the additional research time. Billing: 
As it relates to billing, Missouri law allows the Patrol to charge fees for copies and research time. Specifically, "[r]esearch time required for fulfilling records requests may be charged at the actual cost of research time." Section 610.026, RSMo. The Missouri Supreme Court recently determined that "staff time is the time required to provide access to public records maintained on computer facilities, recording tapes or disks, videotapes or films, pictures, maps, slides, graphics, illustrations or similar audio or visual items". Gross v. Parson, 624 S.W.3d 877, 884-89 (Mo. 2021) (internal quotations omitted). 
The Patrol will never bill you for redaction time or any research time conducted by our legal staff. You will only be charged for copies and staff research time as permitted by Missouri law. Please let us know if you have questions related to the billing estimate. 
Our team will forward a bill estimate to your attention once we have calculated the permissible costs and fees. The Patrol will not provide the responsive records until receipt of payment. Section 610.026.2, RSMo. 
We appreciate your patience as we review, research, and fulfill your open records request. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will receive an email when your request has been completed. If you wish to withdraw or clarify your request, or if you have questions, please call our office at (573) 526-6146, or (573) 526-6167. 
 
Sincerely, 
Gerard G. Callahan 
Custodian of Records

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

-The current memorandum of agreement (MOA) or memorandum of understanding (MOU) with the Defense Logistics Agency, Disposition Services regarding the 1033 equipment surplus program administered by the DLA Law Enforcement Support Office

-The annual inventory form required to be completed by MSP by the state coordinator of the 1033 program

According to the DLA FAQ page regarding the 1033 program, yours is the agency in charge of coordinating the 1033 program for the state. See http://www.dispositionservices.dla.mil/leso/Pages/StateCoordinatorList.aspx

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Fengyue Hu

This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by the Division of Criminal Justice Services on October 11, 2023. -The annual inventory form required to be completed by MSP by the state coordinator of the 1033 program

According to the DLA FAQ page regarding the 1033 program, yours is the agency in charge of coordinating the 1033 program for the state. See http://www.dispositionservices.dla.mil/leso/Pages/StateCoordinatorList.aspx

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.".



Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.



A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 20 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.



Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs. Very truly yours,




Brian Garvey, Esq.

communications.subject: FW: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: 1033 MOU and annual inventory form (New York)
communications.communication:
Dear Fengyue Hu:

This is in response to your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request to the Division of Criminal Justice Services (DCJS) seeking the "current memorandum of agreement (MOA) or memorandum of understanding (MOU) with the Defense Logistics Agency, Disposition Services regarding the 1033 equipment surplus program administered by the DLA Law Enforcement Support Office [and the] the annual inventory form required to be completed by MSP [sic] by the state coordinator of the 1033 program."

In response to your request, attached is the current memorandum of agreement (MOA) or memorandum of understanding (MOU) with the Defense Logistics Agency, Disposition Services regarding the 1033 equipment surplus program administered by the DLA Law Enforcement Support Office.
In response to your request for the annual inventory form required to be completed by the MSP (we assume you mean NY) by the state coordinator of the 1033 program, this form no longer exists. All equipment inventories are listed quarterly on the DLA LESO Public Information page linked below.  On the LESO public information page click on "ALASKA - WYOMING AND US TERRITORIES" for a downloadable EXCEL listing of property held by all participating states and territories. https://www.dla.mil/DispositionServices/Offers/Reutilization/LawEnforcement/PublicInformation/

Pursuant to POL §89(4)(a), you may appeal this determination within 30 days to the Counsel, Division of Criminal Justice Services, 80 South Swan St., Albany, NY 12210 or by email at foil@dcjs.ny.gov<mailto:foil@dcjs.ny.gov>.

Very truly yours,

Gina L. Bianchi, Esq.
for
Brian Garvey, Esq.

title: Heather Johnston Death - Police (Gwinnett County Police Department)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Heather Johnston Death - Police (Gwinnett County Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records, reports, body cam footage and other audio or video recordings related to the death of Heather Faye Besco Johnston. Mrs. Johnston died on or around July 3, 2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cole Howard

title: Open Records Request: Bush & Rawlins Metadata

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Bush & Rawlins Metadata
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Metadata for all email communications sent or received, including being CCed or BCCed, which contain both John Bush and Wayne Rawlins (Wayne@waynerawlins.com) between 3/24/2022 and 10/25/23.

The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and names of all attachments. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please do not include duplicate emails. Please provide me with the records in an Excel format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Victor Gotbaum
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to, mentioning, or generated as a result of investigation into Victor H. Gotbaum (September 5, 1921 - April 5, 2015). Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2015/04/06/nyregion/victor-gotbaum-labor-leader-who-helped-save-new-york-from-bankruptcy-dies-at-93.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1453318-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 138 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 571 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,289 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,649 days for processing.

Respectfully,


Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
F: (540) 868-4391
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

1234567-000

FOIPA

Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process. title: Public Records Request: Violent Crime Intervention Fund

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request: Violent Crime Intervention Fund
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to documents released by the State of Tennessee, the Chatanooga Police Department received $1,631,583 in funding awarded in 2022 from the Violent Crime Intervention Fund: https://www.tn.gov/content/dam/tn/finance/ocjp/VCIF%20Funding%20Plan.pdf

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents related to the $1,631,583 received as part of the 2022 Violent Crime Intervention Fund.  

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with e.

communications.subject: Open Records Request :: W038622-100323
communications.communication:

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: BlueLeaks (Jacksonville Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Documents mentioning, describing or generated in response to the BlueLeaks release, the preceding hack or subsequent fallout, including but not limited to:

* Damage assessments
* Emails
* Interagency communications (local, state, or federal)
* Communications with the press about BlueLeaks
* Communications with Twitter or other social media or sharing platforms

2. Documents mentioning or describing Distributed Denial of Secrets (DDoSecrets)

You may limit this request to records generated between November 1, 2018 and the present.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over 100,000 readers in outlets such as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the People, Unicorn Riot, and The Outline, among others. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available through non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and the journalist non-profit MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the government itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this particular subject in advance.

As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting on it and making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

title: Request to NASA for 2021 film collaborations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to NASA for 2021 film collaborations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all the films that the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the year 2021. Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, entertainment liaison (ELO) reports. I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Resta and Smith 1963 USE OF ELECTRONIC DATA PROCESSING
communications.communication:
Good Morning



This is in response to your below request dated September 5, 2023, requesting 
information under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Under Department of 
Defense rules implementing the FOIA, published at 32 CFR 286, your request was 
categorized as "other". We have assigned our internal number of DTIC FOIA 
2023-533. The document that you have requested, are approved for public 
release. We will begin the process of digitizing the document for you.  This 
process normally takes 2-3 weeks to process but we are experiencing technical 
issues with getting documents through our final processing.  We are currently 
working to resolve this issue.  Not sure of a timeframe as of yet.  Our 
document and IT personnel are working the issue and as soon as the problem is 
resolved we will get this document to you.  We apologize for the delay in 
processing.
Thanks



Mike Hamilton

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Ralph Bunche
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of inquiry or investigation of Ralph Johnson Bunche (August 7, 1904 - December 9, 1971). Proof of death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: Crime Free Housing and Nuisance Ordinance Information Request

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Crime Free Housing and Nuisance Ordinance Information Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past three years (October 2020-October 2023) regarding "crime free" housing and nuisance property ordinances that will be referred to as “program” and "ordinance" respectively, in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as “Crime Free Multi-Housing” and "Chronic Nuisance Abatement" as described in Joliet's Code of Ordinances Chapter 20 Article II Sec. 20-41 through Sec. 20-47. 

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Program and Ordinance including but not limited to:

• any training/presentation materials used in communication, promotions, workshops, seminars, etc

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the program and ordinance

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the ordinance or program

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance and program

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Jenny Wadhwa, 
Thank you for registering with the City of Joliet FOIA Records Center.  Please log in to the Records Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. 
 If you are requesting a copy of your police report, you may receive unredacted portions of the report, such as your personal information and/or your statements (providing the case is not open investigation or pending in court), if a form of photo identification (driver’s license/state ID) is presented to Front Desk desk personnel at either the Joliet Police Department main station or the Joliet Police Department sub station. Photo identification submitted electronically will no longer be accepted as a valid form of identification. Login: 153618-25815960@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://joliet.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx?) 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY. 
 
 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the FOIA Records Center (htthttps://joliet.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/CustomerHome.aspx)

title: DHS Weekly Significant FOIA Activity Reports May-July 2022

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DHS Weekly Significant FOIA Activity Reports May-July 2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All weekly reports of significant FOIA activity received from all DHS component FOIA office by the DHS Privacy Office in May, June, and July of 2022. The responsive records are required for each DHS component FOIA office by the 2/9/2005 Chief Privacy Officer memo. 

This FOIA request is a clone of a prior request, submitted on May 23, 2022, and fulfilled with a release of records in full on August 29, 2022. DHS-FOIA assigned that request tracking number 2022-HQFO-01117. The request and responsive materials are available for review here: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/dhs-significant-foia-activity-april-2022-129129/#.

During the pendency of the prior request, DHS-FOIA clarified that these reports are complied on a weekly basis-rather than by month. 

Please (a) assign this request to simple-track processing; and (b) provide responsive records within the period set forth by statute. 

Thank you, 

Andrew Free
#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative
Al Otro Lado

communications.subject: Other Public Records Updated :: W054192-103023
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

10/31/2023 Re: Public Records Request, dated 10/30/2023 File #W054192-103023 for Other Public Records Matter – Clarification of Request Needed Dear Rose Terse: 
On 10/30/2023, you submitted a public records request to the City of Kent wherein you sought Other Public Records for: Most recent FAA Certificates of Waiver or Authorization (CoAs) for all drones/UAV/UAS currently operated by your department. The City requires clarification of your request before it can proceed.  However, I was unable to contact you by telephone to obtain clarification.  Therefore, by this letter, the City requests you provide clarification of the following issues: Which department are you seeking records for (ie Parks, Police Department, Multimedia)? The City will wait for your clarification before it begins gathering any records that may be responsive to your request.  If you fail to clarify your request within 30 calendar days from the date of this letter, the City will close your request. If you have any questions, please contact the City Clerk’s Office at 253-856-5725. Thank you. Sincerely, Tiffany Alcorn Tiffany Alcorn CPRO - Lead Public Disclosure Administrator City of Kent Administration 
Arthur “Pat” Fitzpatrick, Chief Administrative Officer

title: Government employee salary data (Department of Buildings)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Government employee salary data (Department of Buildings)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the most recent database maintained by this agency detailing compensation and occupation details for individuals in the employ of this agency.

Please provide, if possible, the following pieces of information for each employee: 

• Name of Employee
• Unique ID (if applicable)
• Age
• Gender
• Ethnicity
• Job Title or Position
• Organizational Unit
• Location
• Regular Wages
• Overtime Pay
• Other Pay
• Benefits
• Total Compensation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: MA contributions
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All record types of contribution reports, dated from now to as far back as possible. I request the entire database, including all fields and any documentation necessary to interpret the data. If there are fields that you cannot release, please provide all other fields.

I can accept the data in many formats and on multiple media. I’d be happy to talk with your database administrator to figure out the best way to format the data.

If the fees for processing this request will exceed $40, please provide an itemized estimate of costs. If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: FW: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: MA contributions
communications.communication:
Hello Ileana,

The records you’re requesting are available online here: https://www.ocpf.us/Data

The page includes instructions and data types.

Please write back if you have additional questions.
Best regards,

Jason Tait

Communications Director

OCPF

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: MA contributions
communications.communication:
Hi Jason, 

Thank you for your prompt reply. That webpage only allows me to download the data up to a certain limited number of rows. I am seeking the full database without said limitations. 

Please let me know if you need any additional information. Thank you for your time and assistance.

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Rental Licensing Program Information Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (September 2021-September 2023) regarding your residential rental licensing program that will be referred to as "program"  in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Rental Units, Licensing Of" as described in Chapter 96 in Hyattsville city code. 

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Program including but not limited to:

• any training/presentation materials used in communication, promotions, workshops, seminars, etc

• criminal background checks performed on prospective tenants

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the Program

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the program

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the program 

• meeting minutes and correspondence between municipality officials, regarding the implementation and enforcement of the  program

• all documents concerning the passage of the program and any amendments to it, including communications with City elected officials, city staff, and others, and any data relied upon or reviewed as a part of the passage or amendments to the program since September 2021 to September 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: City of Hyattsville, MD - Records Information Request Confirmation PIR-2023-132
communications.communication:
City of Hyattsville, MD - Records Information Request Confirmation PIR-2023-132 
  
 Dear Requestor, 
  
 Thank you for submitting a request for records on Wednesday, September 13, 2023 at 11:45 PM (Eastern Standard Time). 
  
 Your request reference number is Request Number: PIR-2023-132 and your security key is 674764. 
  
 Please have both reference numbers available when communicating with our staff regarding your request. 
  
 The City will begin processing your request shortly. Due to the volume of requests received the City anticipates that it will take longer than 10 working days to produce the responsive records. Under the Maryland Public Information Act, the City will provide a response within 30-days of the request. 
  
 The first two hours of search and review are provided free of charge. Fees for time over two hours may vary depending on the time and hourly rates of the individual staff and attorneys who must conduct the review. The City does not yet know whether the records requested will require review time in excess of two hours but will inform you as soon as possible if they do. If any requested records are to be withheld, the City's response will explain the reason for that. 
  
 To communicate with staff regarding your request, please contact the City Clerk's Office at cityclerk@hyattsville.org or call 301--985-5009. 
  
 Thank you, 
 City of Hyattsville

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Clearview AI contracts and policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Materials describing this agency's relationship with and use of products by Clearview AI, a face recognition company.

CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS
Any and all agreements related to the acquisition and use of this "software," algorithm, or program. This includes (but is not limited to):
• all contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits)
• data sharing agreements
• insurance agreements
• intergovernmental services agreements
• licensing agreements
• memorandums of understanding, and
• nondisclosure agreements
• any relevant Requests for Expressions of Interest, Requests For Proposal (or equivalent calls for bids), responses to Requests for Expressions of Interest, letters of interest, responses to Requests for Proposal, sole source or limited source justification and approval documentation, documentation of selection, and other materials generated in the consideration and selection of the technology in question.

FINANCIAL and FUNDING MATERIALS
• Any records related to the financing or funding of this face recognition technology or system, including a copy of any related funding opportunity announcements, grant applications, grantor status/progress reports, purchase orders, invoices, and other memoranda and documentation related to the payment or cost (or lack thereof) of the face recognition technology or system, related technology, personnel, equipment, or other elements concerning this face recognition technology or system or program.

POLICIES, INSTRUCTIONAL, TRAINING, AND USE MATERIALS
• All instructional materials, presentations, and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on the use of face recognition technology or system. This includes any notes taken during meetings that discussed the use of the software, any explanations (whether generated internally or externally) of how the face recognition technology or system works, and any other document that has been used to help explain the use of the face recognition technology or system to any party, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.
• This also includes training materials governing the use, sharing, or access to the face recognition technology or system or any data related to or collected by the face recognition software/technology, including the legal standard that is required before using the technology.
• Please provide a copy of any policies, policy directives, guidance documents, memoranda, training materials, or similar records governing the use and function of this technology for immigration, law enforcement, or any purpose, including all those related to data retention, permissible and impermissible use, and security standards. This would include materials that describe the application, function, and use of the face recognition technology or system, including advertisements, emails, handouts, usage policies, PowerPoint presentations, specification documents, or standard operating procedures.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Snelgrove

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Delta Crescent transition emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails sent to or received from Delta Crescent LLC, James Cain, James Reese, and/or John P. Dorrier Jr. by any OFAC employee between November 3, 2020 and January 20, 2021.

Please include any files attached to responsive emails as well.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an investigative journalist who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, Reason Magazine, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: Request confirmation of modified scope in FOIA case 2021-FOIA-00430
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Petti;

Re:      FOIA #: 2021-FOIA-00430
            Subj: Request confirmation of modified scope

Thank you for taking our telephone call today regarding your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request for emails sent to or received from Delta Crescent LLC, James Cain, James Reese, and/or John P. Dorrier Jr. by any OFAC employee between November 3, 2020 and January 20, 2021.

Request: Please verify by return email to me, no later than, Friday March 26, 2021, that you have modified the scope of your request to: emails sent to or received from Delta Crescent LLC, James Cain, James Reese, and/or John P. Dorrier Jr. by those OFAC Licensing employees who have dealt with Delta Crescent between November 3, 2020 and January 20, 2021.

Summary of meeting: We discussed the fact that the way your request is initially written all employees of OFAC would have to search their emails for records responsive to your request, even though they would not have any responsive records. By modifying the scope to the individuals who worked on the Delta Crescent matter, OFAC would be able to process your request in a much more timely manner.

If we do not hear back from you in the time indicated, OFAC will move forward with processing your request as modified.

Please be advised that your request has been assigned FOIA number 2021-FOIA-00430. Please reference this number in all communications regarding this request. You can contact us at our FOIA Requester Service Center via email to: OFACFOIAOffice@treasury.gov<mailto:OFACFOIAOffice@treasury.gov> or telephonically at 202-622-2500, option 3.

Sincerely,

Marshall Fields
Assistant Director
Information Disclosure and Records Management
Office of Sanctions Support and Operations
Office of Foreign Assets Control

Confidentiality Notice:
      This email may contain privileged, confidential and or law enforcement sensitive information which is exempt from disclosure under applicable law.  If you have received this communication in error, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of the communication is strictly prohibited.  If you have received this communication in error, please notify the sender.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2021-FOIA-00430
communications.communication:
Mr. Fields,

Thank you for your phone call earlier today. I can confirm that we agreed to limit the scope of request number 2021-FOIA-00430 (OASIS No. 1183823) from "any OFAC employee" to "those OFAC Licensing employees who have dealt with Delta Crescent." I look forward to moving forward with this modified request. Again, thank you for your attention to this case, and I look forward to working with you moving forward.

Best regards,
Matthew Petti

This is Matthew Petti, and I am writing in response to your October 18, 2021 email regarding my request number 2019-11-053. Thank you for reaching out. Because MuckRock generates a unique email for each FOIA request, it would be best if we continued to use this address only for 2021-FOIA-00430. Best regards,
Matthew

title: Clearview AI contracts and policies (Mansfield Police Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Clearview AI contracts and policies (Mansfield Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Materials describing this agency's relationship with and use of products by Clearview AI, a face recognition company.

CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS
Any and all agreements related to the acquisition and use of this "software," algorithm, or program. This includes (but is not limited to):
• all contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits)
• data sharing agreements
• insurance agreements
• intergovernmental services agreements
• licensing agreements
• memorandums of understanding, and
• nondisclosure agreements
• any relevant Requests for Expressions of Interest, Requests For Proposal (or equivalent calls for bids), responses to Requests for Expressions of Interest, letters of interest, responses to Requests for Proposal, sole source or limited source justification and approval documentation, documentation of selection, and other materials generated in the consideration and selection of the technology in question.

FINANCIAL and FUNDING MATERIALS
• Any records related to the financing or funding of this face recognition technology or system, including a copy of any related funding opportunity announcements, grant applications, grantor status/progress reports, purchase orders, invoices, and other memoranda and documentation related to the payment or cost (or lack thereof) of the face recognition technology or system, related technology, personnel, equipment, or other elements concerning this face recognition technology or system or program.

POLICIES, INSTRUCTIONAL, TRAINING, AND USE MATERIALS
• All instructional materials, presentations, and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on the use of face recognition technology or system. This includes any notes taken during meetings that discussed the use of the software, any explanations (whether generated internally or externally) of how the face recognition technology or system works, and any other document that has been used to help explain the use of the face recognition technology or system to any party, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.
• This also includes training materials governing the use, sharing, or access to the face recognition technology or system or any data related to or collected by the face recognition software/technology, including the legal standard that is required before using the technology.
• Please provide a copy of any policies, policy directives, guidance documents, memoranda, training materials, or similar records governing the use and function of this technology for immigration, law enforcement, or any purpose, including all those related to data retention, permissible and impermissible use, and security standards. This would include materials that describe the application, function, and use of the face recognition technology or system, including advertisements, emails, handouts, usage policies, PowerPoint presentations, specification documents, or standard operating procedures.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Evan Lake

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Truleo Contracts (Alameda Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Contracts, agreements, invoices, and any supporting documentation related to the use of applications named or provided by Truleo.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mitchell Kotler

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Truleo Contracts (Alameda Police Department)
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,


Alameda Police Department is in receipt of your request pursuant to the California Public Records Act for Contracts, agreements, invoices, and any supporting documentation related to the use of applications named or provided by Truleo dated October 27, 2023.



We are attaching our payment tracking sheets and copies of the invoices along with our most recent and the prior agreements.



If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.



Thank you,

Rita Dharmani
Records Manager
Alameda Police Department
Ph. 510-337-8412
Email: rdharmani@alamedaca.gov

CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: This transmittal is intended only for the use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed and may contain information that is privileged, confidential, and exempt from disclosure under applicable law.  If the reader of this transmittal is not the intended recipient or the employee or agent responsible for delivering the transmittal to the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution, or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited.

You can monitor the progress of your request by logging into My Request Center on the Portal. Thank you for using the Chula Vista's City Public Records Center. Thank you, 
 City of Chula Vista Police Department

communications.communication:

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of October 26, 2023., Reference # P000239-102623. 
Dear Dhruv Mehrotra, 
The City of Chula Vista is in receipt of your October 26, 2023 request for the following public records pursuant to the California Public Records Act (“CPRA”) (Cal. Gov. Code section 7920.000 et seq.): To Whom It May Concern:" 

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

On 2-05-22 around 1:30pm, CVPD responded to a call for service around the 200 block of Whitney St. The incident number is 220205L00010304 or L010304. I am looking for any call detail log, incident report ( including a narrative summary), investigatory report, arrest report, or log of drone activity for this event. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Public Records Request: Violent Crime Intervention Fund

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request: Violent Crime Intervention Fund
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to documents released by the State of Tennessee, the Murfreesboro Police Department received $1,161,228in funding awarded in 2022 from the Violent Crime Intervention Fund: https://www.tn.gov/content/dam/tn/finance/ocjp/VCIF%20Funding%20Plan.pdf

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents related to the $1,161,228 received as part of the 2022 Violent Crime Intervention Fund.  

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with e.

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A CSV file where each row represents a traffic stop made by Florida Highway Patrol (all troops) between 2018 and 2022 and which contains the following columns: date, time, location, county_name, subject_age, subject_race, subject_sex, officer_id_hash, officer_age, officer_race, officer_sex, officer_years_of_service, department_name, unit, type, violation, arrest_made, citation_issued, warning_issued, outcome, frisk_performed, search_conducted, search_basis, reason_for_search, reason_for_stop, vehicle_registration_state.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alexander Love

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Chicago Request Center!

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Foffice-of-emergency-communications-6313%252Fnew-arrivals-mission-incident-action-plan-152313%252F%253Femail%253DOEMCFOIA%252540cityofchicago.org&url_auth_token=AAAUgKrPDOzkpVvOc_l8VxhL-TI%3A1qjVMC%3AGmU1EI-c_HqtE_UA5PtOQ6o9p7Q7hlVlH75DpN7f2fs In response to your request, the OEMC is providing you with the redacted "Situation Reports". Be advised, email addresses and personal telephone numbers have been redacted from the attached records pursuant to 7(1)(b) of FOIA, which provides that public bodies may redact information that is considered private.  5 ILCS 2(c-5) of FOIA defines private information as follows: "Private information" means unique identifiers, including a person's social security number, driver's license number, employee identification number, biometric identifiers, personal financial information, passwords or other access codes, medical records, home or personal telephone numbers and email addresses.  Private information also includes home address and personal license plates, except as otherwise provided by law or when compiled without possibility of attribution to any person. Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. "Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy" means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject's right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. To the extent a portion of your FOIA request has been denied, you have a right of review by the Illinois Attorney General's Public Access Counselor who can be contacted at 500 S. Second St., Springfield, IL 62706 or by telephone at (877)-299-FOIA. Email: public.access@ilag.gov. You may also seek judicial review of a denial under 5 ILCS 140/11 of FOIA. Sincerely, M. Mason - OEMC FOIA Freedom of Information Officer Office of Emergency Management & Communications 1411 W Madison Chicago IL 60607 312-746-9403
